Article Title: Right to Disconnect Bill 2025: Supriya Sule moves legislation to promote work-life balance for employees after office hours
Article Text:
Supriya Sule (ANI image)

NEW DELHI: Lok Sabha member Supriya Sule has introduced a private member's Bill in the Lower House to promote work-life balance for workers and employees in India.The Bill, "The Right to Disconnect Bill, 2025", seeks to impose sanctions at a rate of 1 per cent of the total remuneration of its employees on entities (companies or societies) for any non-compliance with the provisions of the Bill.The Bill, as introduced in the Lok Sabha on Friday, provides every employee the right to disconnect from work-related electronic communications."It aims to foster a better quality of life and a healthier work-life balance by reducing the "burnout caused by today's digital culture," she wrote on X.While digital and communication technology offer benefits in terms of work flexibility, it also carries a significant risk of eroding the boundaries between professional and personal life, she argued in the private member's Bill."Studies have found that if an employee is expected to be available round the clock, they tend to exhibit risks of over-work like sleep deprivation, developing stress and being emotionally exhausted. This persistent urge to respond to calls and emails (termed as 'telepressure'), constant checking of emails throughout the day, and even on weekends and holidays, is reported to have destroyed the work-life balance of employees," the statement of objects and reasons of the Bill read."According to a study, the constant monitoring of work related messages and emails, may overtax employees' brains leading to a condition called 'info-obesity'."The Bill argued that there is a need to respect the personal space of the employees by recognising their right to disconnect and not respond to their employer's calls, emails etc., during out-of-work hours."The need is also to recognise the rights of the employees, it also takes into consideration the competitive needs of the companies and their diverse work cultures. Flexibility in the right to disconnect rules and leaves it to the individual companies to negotiate terms of service with their employees is need of the hour," the Bill further read.The digital transformation has direct impact on conditions in the employment contract, like the time and the place of work.Hence if an employee agrees to works during out-of-work hours, overtime pay at the same rate as his wage rate is also necessary to check the surge in unpaid overtime work, brought about by digital transformation, she argued in the Bill.The Bill also provides for counselling services to increase awareness among employees and citizens, on reasonable use of digital and communication tools, for professional and personal use.To free an employee from digital distractions and enable him to truly connect with the people around him, the Bill provides for digital detox centres."The Bill thus champions for the rights and welfare of employees, by mandating individual entities to negotiate out-of-hour service conditions with their employees, and upholding the right of employee to disconnect. The Bill seeks to recognise right to disconnect as a way to reduce stress and ease tension between an employees' personal and professional life," the Bill concluded.She introduced all together what she termed forward-looking Private Member Bills in the Parliament - the other two were The Paternity and Paternal Benefits Bill, 2025. It introduces paid paternal leave to ensure fathers have the legal right to take part in their child's early development. It breaks the traditional model, supports the new mother's well-being, and promotes flexible parenting.The other one is the Code on Social Security (Amendment) Bill, 2025, that recognises platform-based gig workers as a distinct category, ensuring minimum wages, regulated hours, social security, fair conditions, and equitable contracts to ensure a fairer, more sustainable environment and economy for them.Several other members of the Lok Sabha also introduced their Private Member Bills in the House.
Article Summary: Lok sabha member supriya sule has introduced a private member's bill to promote work-life balance for workers and employees in india. The bill, "the right to disconnect bill, 2025", seeks to impose sanctions at a rate of 1 per cent of the total remuneration of its employees.

Article Title: $108-bn hostile bid: Paramount moves to take over Warner Bros; challenges Netflix‚Äôs $72-bn offer
Article Text:
Netflix Drops A $72b Bombshell On Hollywood With Mega Warner Bros Discovery Move | WHAT IT MEANS

Paramount vs Netflix: A corporate showdown





Political and regulatory twist in Paramount vs Netflix





Paramount vs Netflix: What‚Äôs at stake in Hollywood

Market reaction

NEW DELHI: Paramount has launched a $108 billion hostile bid to acquire Warner Bros Discovery (WBD), directly appealing to shareholders just days after WBD agreed to be acquired by Netflix. The move sets up a rare, high-stakes media battle that could reshape global entertainment.The offer, announced late Monday, comes from Paramount and its CEO David Ellison , who told CNBC the bid aims ‚Äúto finish what we started.‚Äù The all-cash offer of $30 per share is pitched as a more secure alternative to Netflix‚Äôs $27.75-per-share proposal made last week.Paramount argues its bid ‚Äúprovides shareholders $18 billion more in cash than the Netflix consideration‚Äù and offers ‚Äúa quicker path to completion,‚Äù according to an official statement.Netflix agreed on Friday to buy WBD‚Äôs studios and HBO Max after the entertainment giant splits into two companies. Paramount accused Warner of failing to ‚Äúmeaningfully engage‚Äù despite submitting six takeover proposals in 12 weeks. The company signalled it is prepared for a prolonged tender battle, despite having a much smaller market value of around $14 billion, compared to Netflix‚Äôs $400+ billion.Also read: Warner Bros-Netflix deal - Is the Tudum effect harmful for Indian cinema? 'The risk is two-fold' The Paramount bid is backed by the Ellison family, RedBird Capital, and $54 billion in debt commitments from Bank of America, Citi and Apollo.Paramount warned WBD shareholders that Netflix‚Äôs takeover is unlikely to clear global regulators. Netflix, however, has included a $5.8 billion breakup fee in its terms, signalling confidence. Co-CEO Ted Sarandos said he is ‚Äúhighly confident‚Äù the deal will be approved.US President Donald Trump weighed in, telling reporters the Netflix deal ‚Äúcould be a problem‚Äù due to market dominance and adding, ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be involved in that decision.‚ÄùIf Warner backs out of the Netflix deal to accept another offer, it must pay $2.8 billion to Netflix.Whoever wins will control some of the most valuable franchises in entertainment, including HBO, Harry Potter, DC Comics, and CNN. If Netflix succeeds, analysts say it will cement the company‚Äôs control over Hollywood content and accelerate disruptions to theatres and artificial intelligence-driven filmmaking.If Paramount prevails, Warner would become part of a media empire led by Ellison and Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison, who are also positioned to take control of TikTok‚Äôs U.S. operations under a deal championed by Trump.Warner shares closed at $26.08, below Netflix‚Äôs offer price, signalling investor doubt the deal will close. Paramount shares fell nearly 10%, an unusual move as shareholders typically celebrate avoiding massive acquisition costs.The bidding war could escalate, say analysts, noting similar competitive takeovers have occurred only when exceptionally coveted assets hit the market.
Article Summary: Paramount has launched a $108 billion hostile bid to acquire warner bros discovery. The move sets up a rare, high-stakes media battle that could reshape global entertainment. Netflix agreed on friday to buy wbd‚Äôs studios and hbo max after the entertainment giant splits into two companies.

Article Title: What is Connor Bedard‚Äôs net worth?: A look into the salary, contract details, and endorsement of the Chicago Blackhawk winger
Article Text:
Chicago Blackhawks forward Connor Bedard ( Image via Getty Images)

Connor Bedard‚Äôs net worth and salary in 2025

Connor Bedard is bringing the ATTITUDE! üí™üò§

Connor Bedard‚Äôs endorsements in 2025

Connor Bedard‚Äôs NHL career



Also read

Connor Bedard is one of the most popular marquee players in the NHL, who has proved his place in the Chicago Blackhawks with his professional skills and skating speed is dominating the ice now. The 20-year-old phenom has brought good fortune in terms of his value and net worth with exceptional skills and speed, leading to substantial net worth.Selected first overall in the 2023 NHL Draft, he quickly established himself as one of the league‚Äôs most promising young talents. Besides, Connor Bedard not only dominates the ice with the Chicago Blackhawks but also his bank account. Let's take a look at Bedard's net worth and salary in 2025.Connor Bedard is one of the most prominent forwards of all time who plays for the Chicago Blackhawks . Apart from his professional life, he has also amassed a huge wealth in his lifetime. According to Celebrity Net Worth, he has a net worth of $5 million. His average annual salary under his current contract is $4.45 million.Connor has signed a lucrative three-year contract worth $13.35 million with the Chicago Blackhawks that contributes to his net worth.For the 2025‚Äì26 season, Bedard will earn a base salary of $855,000 and a signing bonus of $95,000, boosting his worth in the coming days.As per the latest information, Bedard has signed an endorsement with the Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce through a major partnership announced in 2023. Bedard also signed another significant endorsement deal with Gatorade Canada last year. Apart from this, he had already secured endorsements with Sher-Wood, Canadian fashion brand Lululemon, and sports drink company BioSteel.Connor Bedard became the Chicago Blackhawks‚Äô top pick in the 2023 NHL Draft, which has made him quite a name for himself. In his rookie season, he snagged the 2024 Calder Trophy, leading his team with 22 goals, 39 assists, and a total of 61 points, all while battling through an injury. At just 18 years old, he became one of the youngest players ever to score five points in a single NHL game and helped Canada clinch gold at the 2023 World Juniors. Before stepping into the NHL spotlight, Bedard joined the WHL, racking up multiple accolades and an impressive 143 points in just 57 games for Regina.
Article Summary: Connor bedard is one of the most prominent forwards of all time who plays for the chicago blackhawks. The 20-year-old phenom has brought good fortune in terms of his value and net worth. According to celebrity net worth, he has a net worth of $5 million. His average annual salary under his current contract is $4.45 million.

Article Title: After losing more than $70 billion, Mark Zuckerberg seems to have finally admitted that his biggest bet is 'not working'
Article Text:
$70 billion in losses and counting

Layoffs may be coming to Meta

Meta‚Äôs Secret AI Army: Top Talent Hired from OpenAI, Google & More







Where Metaverse budget cuts may go

Meta reportedly delays MR glasses

The day Facebook changed its name to Meta





Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg seems to have finally realised that one of the company's biggest bets‚ÄîMetaverse‚Äîis not working (or not working as expected). It is also the technology that the company changed its very name after. In 2021, after 17 years of being called Facebook, the social networking parent company behind Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and Oculus changed its name to Meta. Now according to a report from Bloomberg, Meta is likely to slash its Reality Labs budget, shaving off as much as 30%. The proposed metaverse cuts are reportedly part of the company's annual budget planning for 2026, which included a series of meetings at Zuckerberg's compound in Hawaii last month.For those unaware, Metaverse unit works on virtual reality headsets and a VR-based social network, which produces the company's Quest mixed-reality headsets, smart glasses made with EssilorLuxottica's Ray-Ban and upcoming augmented-reality glasses. Meta has struggled to sell its vision of an immersive metaverse of interconnected virtual worlds and expand the market for its devices beyond the niche of the gaming community.Analysts see the move reflecting the overall lack of interest in products like Meta‚Äôs social virtual reality platform Horizon Worlds, as well as its virtual reality hardware‚Äîboth in the industry at large, as well as among consumers.Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg‚Äôs Metaverse vision has posted more than $70 billion in losses over the past four years. Little doubt then that Facebook parent's shares rose 4% as the move eased some investor jitters over a bet that CEO Mark Zuckerberg has backed with billions of dollars. "Smart move, just late," told Huber Research Partners analyst Craig Huber to Bloomberg. He added, "This seems a major shift to align costs with a revenue outlook that surely is not as prosperous as management thought years ago. "So, what may really be troubling Metaverse? No one can really pinpoint. But as a report in Fortune says, for many people, the problem is that the value proposition is unclear; Metaverse simply doesn‚Äôt yet deliver a must-have reason to ditch their smartphones or laptops.Reality Labs is made up of a Metaverse unit and a wearables unit. Within the Metaverse unit, executives are reportedly considering making cuts to VR jobs. As the report says, cuts in resources that high are most likely to include layoffs as early as January.The report comes as Meta scrambles to stay relevant in Silicon Valley's artificial-intelligence race after its Llama 4 model met with a poor reception. To fuel its ambitious goals, Meta has committed as much as $72 billion in capital spending this year. The company reorganized its AI efforts under Superintelligence Labs earlier this year, with Zuckerberg said to be personally leading an aggressive talent acquisition, floating offers for startups and directly courting prospects on WhatsApp with million-dollar pay packages. In fact, Meta's big hiring is said to have triggered a talent war in the Silicon Valley.Last month, Meta Platforms said that it will invest $600 billion in the US infrastructure and jobs over the next three years, including artificial intelligence data centers. Meta has doubled down on AI, with a target of achieving superintelligence. Zuckerberg said Meta is building compute because "it's the right strategy to aggressively front-load capacity so we're prepared for the most optimistic cases," on the company's recent earnings call. Meta has forecast "notably larger" capital expenses next year thanks to investments in artificial intelligence, including aggressively building data centers to power its AI push.Incidentally, earlier this week, Zuckerberg announced that Alan Dye, a longtime designer at Apple, is joining Meta to lead a new creative studio inside the Reality Labs division that would focus on design, fashion and technology. Dye will report to Andrew Bosworth, Meta‚Äôs chief technology officer, who leads Reality Labs. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre entering a new era where A.I. glasses and other devices will change how we connect with technology and each other,‚Äù Mr. Zuckerberg said in a post to Threads. ‚ÄúWith this new studio, we‚Äôre focused on making every interaction thoughtful, intuitive, and built to serve people.‚ÄùMeta has reportedly delayed the launch of its Mixed Reality Glasses (MR Glasses) from the second half of 2026 to the first half of 2027. According to a report in Business Insider, Meta executives announced the delay after meetings with CEO Mark Zuckerberg is said to have told the team to take more time to make the business sustainable and deliver higher quality experiences.In October 2021, after 17 years of being called Facebook, the social networking giant behind Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and Oculus got a new name. Facebook‚Äôs corporate entity became Meta. Mark Zuckerberg announced the change at the company‚Äôs AR/VR-focused Connect event, sharing that the new title captured more of the company‚Äôs core ambition: to build the metaverse.
Article Summary: $70 billion in losses and counting.layoffs may be coming to meta. Metaverse unit works on virtual reality headsets and a vr-based social network. Analysts see the move reflecting the overall lack of interest in products like meta‚Äôs social virtual reality platform horizon worlds. Facebook's mixed reality glasses set to launch in 2027.

Article Title: Phoebe Gates gets $30 million for Phia, that made father Bill Gates say: When your daughter asks if you‚Äôd be willing to work a shift in ‚Ä¶
Article Text:
‚ÄúI‚Äôve entered the startup world again‚Ä¶When your daughter asks if you‚Äôd be willing to work a shift in customer service at her startup, the only right answer is yes.

I‚Äôve spent a lot of time thinking about how technology can make systems more efficient, equitable, and accessible.

But I‚Äôve learned over the years that the best way to understand how something works, or where it breaks, is to go straight to the people using it.

That‚Äôs why I‚Äôll be joining the Phia customer experience team for a day this week. Phia is a fashion-tech tool built to make shopping smarter and more sustainable, and it‚Äôs the brainchild of my daughter Phoebe Gates and her co-founder

Sophia Kianni

.

They‚Äôve built an app and browser extension that helps people shop smarter by finding the best prices, surfacing secondhand options, and showing lower-impact alternatives across thousands of online retailers.

It‚Äôs been inspiring to watch them tackle a massive challenge, rethinking the way we shop, by meeting users where they are.

And now, I‚Äôll be doing the same.

Looking forward to getting back into the startup scene. Hopefully, I won‚Äôt break anything (no promises).

üì≤Download the Phia iOS app for free at join.phia.com

üíªOr if you shop on your computer like me, they have a free chrome extension at gophia.com

Let me know what you think! You never know who‚Äôs on the other end of the customer service line‚Ä¶‚Äù

How the latest funding round will help Phoebe Gates Phia app





Microsoft founder Bill Gates ' daughter Phoebe Gates has raised $30 million funding for her artificial intelligence (AI) shopping startup, Phia. The new funding values the company at $180 million. However, Phoebe Gates‚Äô father has yet to invested in the venture. Instead, the Bill Gates donated his time and experience to her daughter‚Äôs startup. Earlier this year, the tech billionaire took to professional networking site LinkedIn to announce that he was doing a customer service shift to support the team in the days following the launch of the app. He said when a daughter asks for help at her startup, the only right answer is yes.In his LinkedIn post, Bill Gates shared a short clip offering a glimpse of his shift working in the customer service department of his daughter‚Äôs app. He wrote:The latest round of funding is a massive leap in value for Phoebe Gates' startup, coming just months after the New York-based company finished its first fundraising round. It will make the startup one of the most-watched companies in the booming AI market.The company has attracted a long list of famous backers. According to a pitch deck viewed by Bloomberg, investors include Hailey Bieber, Kris Jenner, Sheryl Sandberg, and Spanx founder Sara Blakely.Phia has been designed to serve as an intelligent shopping assistant. Its being offered as an AI agent that will fix the messy online shopping experience. According to the company, customers usually struggle to find what they want and companies end up advertising to people who aren‚Äôt interested and Phia will be able to resolve it.As a computer and mobile phone browser extension, Phia searches for products, price comparisons, and real-time discounts to help users in their buying decisions. Second-hand options are also highlighted by Phia to further assist people in shopping more 'green'.The new financial round is being led by major investment firms, including Notable Capital, Kleiner Perkins, and Khosla Ventures; investors with a history of supporting giants in the tech sector, such as Airbnb.Phia says it was downloaded 750,000 times in just eight months. The idea by Phoebe Gates and her co-founder Sophia Kianni was born while living in a Stanford dorm room; the initial plans were to make a smart tampon but later changed to fashion technology.
Article Summary: Microsoft founder bill gates'daughter phoebe gates has raised $30 million funding for her artificial intelligence (ai) shopping startup, phia. Earlier this year, the tech billionaire took to professional networking site linkedin to announce that he was doing a customer service shift to support the team in the days following the launch of the app.

Article Title: NYT Connections today‚Äôs hints and answers (#911) for 08 December 2025
Article Text:
What is NYT Connections

Yellow Group: Encouragement words

Green Group: Streets in Los Angeles

Purple Group: capitals with a twist

Yellow Group: Words that pair with on for encouragement or urging.

Green Group: Well-known streets or think of Los Angeles landmarks.

NYT Connections answers for December 08, 2025

Green Group: MULHOLLAND, RODEO, SUNSET, VINE

Blue Group: COWBOY, MAVERICK, STAR, WING

Purple Group: MINK (Minsk), PARS (Paris), ROE (Rome), SOFA (Sofia)

NYT Connections related FAQs



How do I play the game?

Are hints available?

Can I play NYT Connections for free?

What skills does the game improve?





The New York Times‚Äô Connections has quickly become a favourite among word puzzle enthusiasts, blending the addictive simplicity of Wordle with more complex challenges in logic and pattern recognition. Each day, players face 16 seemingly random words arranged in a 4x4 grid, tasked with sorting them into four distinct thematic groups. Success depends on identifying subtle connections, associations, and clever wordplay, making the game both fun and mentally stimulating. For puzzle lovers looking to test their skills, the December 08, 2025 edition (game #911) offers an ideal mix of challenge and insight, encouraging lateral thinking, careful observation, and strategic reasoning. Connections continues to captivate a global audience as a daily exercise in cognitive skill and mental agility.NYT Connections is a captivating word association game designed to test analytical thinking, lateral reasoning, and cognitive flexibility. Unlike standard word games, players must detect subtle links between words, which can range from obvious to highly nuanced or abstract. The game is freely available on mobile devices and desktop platforms, allowing enthusiasts to play anytime, anywhere, at their convenience.Its combination of easy-to-understand mechanics, challenging puzzles, and complex problem-solving has turned it into a daily ritual for many. The game‚Äôs structure encourages players to sharpen their pattern recognition, develop strategic thinking, improve memory retention, and enjoy a mental workout while having fun.To assist players without giving away the answers directly, here are strategic hints for December 08, 2025:These hints guide players toward recognising patterns, encouraging logical deduction and strategic grouping without removing the challenge entirely.Check below the today's NYT Connections categories to solve the puzzle:For those ready to review their solutions or learn from the puzzle logic, the complete answers for game #911 are:Connections continues to captivate players worldwide, turning each puzzle into a thrilling hunt for hidden patterns, where every correct grouping sparks a moment of ‚Äúaha!‚Äù and keeps the mind sharp for the next challenge.Words are presented in a 4x4 grid. Identify patterns or associations to sort them into four correct categories.Yes, the game provides subtle hints to guide players without revealing the answers outright.Yes, it is available for free on both mobile devices and desktop platforms.It sharpens pattern recognition, logical thinking, lateral reasoning, and problem-solving skills.
Article Summary: Nyt connections is a captivating word association game designed to test analytical thinking, lateral reasoning, and cognitive flexibility. Each day, players face 16 seemingly random words arranged in a 4x4 grid, tasked with sorting them into four distinct thematic groups.

Article Title: Vivo S50, S50 Pro mini to launch on December 15: Expected processor, camera and other features
Article Text: Vivo is set to launch its S50 series smartphones in China on December 15, with pre-orders now open. The lineup includes the Vivo S50 and S50 Pro mini, featuring multiple color options and powerful Snapdragon chipsets. Both models are expected to boast a 50MP periscope telephoto camera and impressive storage capacities.

Article Title: Elon Musk's Starlink announces satellite internet pricing for India: Offers 30-day free trial and more
Article Text:
Starlink has unveiled its satellite internet plans for India, charging Rs 8,600 monthly with a Rs 34,000 hardware kit. Promising unlimited data and high uptime, the service targets remote areas. With regulatory approval secured, Starlink aims to compete with existing providers, offering a 30-day trial for its plug-and-play solution.

Starlink‚Äôs residential connection includes 30-day trial and plug-and-play setup to cost Rs 34,000

SpaceX Gateway network to span across six cities, and Bengaluru office expands





Elon Musk's Starlink has revealed the residential satellite internet pricing for India at Rs 8,600 monthly, plus a Rs 34,000 hardware kit, as the SpaceX subsidiary prepares for commercial operations. The service targets households in remote and underserved areas with promises of unlimited data, 99.9% uptime, and weather-resistant connectivity where traditional broadband infrastructure fails to reach.Following regulatory clearance from the Department of Telecommunications in July, Starlink is positioning itself to challenge established players Jio-SES and Eutelsat OneWeb in India's satellite communications sector.The residential plan, priced at a monthly subscription cost of Rs 8,600 offers unlimited data without usage caps or throttling, addressing critical connectivity gaps in rural regions. Starlink's system requires minimal installation effort, with users simply powering on equipment and pointing it skyward to establish connections. However, the hardware kit will cost customers Rs 34,000, which the company says is a one time fees.The company guarantees over 99.9% uptime and all-weather functionality, crucial features for areas experiencing frequent service disruptions.New customers receive a 30-day trial period, allowing households to evaluate performance before long-term commitment. This trial provision acknowledges the premium pricing structure, which places Starlink among India's higher-cost broadband options despite targeting underserved markets.Business subscription pricing remains unannounced, with enterprise-focused plans expected as commercial rollout advances.Starlink is deploying gateway earth stations across Chandigarh, Hyderabad, Kolkata, Lucknow, Mumbai, and Noida to enable satellite-to-ground communications. These relay installations are essential for maintaining low-latency connections and service reliability across India's varied geography.The company posted four specialist positions at its Bengaluru office in October, recruiting talent in payments, accounting, treasury, and tax operations as part of infrastructure expansion. This direct-to-consumer strategy distinguishes Starlink from competitors concentrating on enterprise clients, potentially reshaping internet accessibility in regions where fiber deployment remains economically unviable.
Article Summary: Spacex subsidiary unveils residential satellite internet plans for india. Promises unlimited data, 99.9% uptime, and weather-resistant connectivity where traditional broadband infrastructure fails to reach. 30-day trial and plug-and-play setup costs rs 34,000.
